title.narrative: Strengthening of Office of the Minister of State for Administrative Reform , phase 2

description.narrative: Supporting civil service reform initiatives undertaken by OMSAR to modernize public sector organizations through the latest management and ICT tools to further improve their service delivery and facilitate the fulfillment of their missions.

participating-org.narrative: LEB-OFFICE OF THE MINISTER OF STATE FOR ADMINISTRATIVE REFORM

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: No. of policy reforms legislated and implementation plans adopted

comment.narrative: Administrative Reform Strategy adopted by Office of the State for Administrative Reform in 2012, small and medium enterprise strategy developed in 2014, Statistical Master plan developed (2015)

Legal framework for Anti-corruption Accountability and oversight Transparency in budgeting and financial reporting Transparency in public procurement Digitalization of PA and public services Information base and access to information

New strategic plan (mission, vision statements, updated principles & values, strategic goals & objectives ) for OMSAR (2020 – 2027) A draft law (قانون معجل مكرر) to legalize the Appointment Mechanism in Lebanese Public Administrations and Institutions. Develop and enhance the Anti-Corruption Strategy in terms of making it more in line with international standards mainly the United Nations Convention Against Corruption. Together with Gherbal, The project developed a guide for Access to Information Law targeting citizens Revamp digital transformation strategy and action plan 2020-2030

. Follow-up on the ratification of public procurement regulations and conduct activities to support the execution of public contracts in compliance with international standards pertaining to fairness and efficiency . Support the adoption of the required legal frameworks of the anti corruption basket of draft laws, mainly: Illicit enrichment; conflicts of interest; access to information; and whistle blowers protection. . Introduce modern structures and review mandates and roles of the control bodies and other relevant public administrations. . Develop a methodology for Regulatory Impact assessment and adopt it to relevant draft laws and decrees under preparation. . Develop strategic planning capacities in the public administration . Identify potential for outsourcing some government functions and activities to the private sector . Promote the adoption of sectoral and organizational Performance Evaluation methodologies at the Central Inspection . Support the CAS in producing economic, social, gender, poverty statistics in addition to strengthening the management of statistical surveys . Launch and implement a Performance Improvement Planning Project (PIP) in three public entities. . Establishing one-stop shops (single window service) in relevant ministries Established . Adopt Digital Government Strategy with needed commitments and endorsements . Improve the E-Government Infrastructure (Secure Government Network, Fail over data center, Gateways for Interoperability, Payment and Authentication) . Enhance and Promote the E-Government Portal – DAWLATI (better enrollment and better authentication, integration of billing information and payment, improvement of the mobile features of DAWLATI) . Citizens / Client oriented management . Technical and Administrative support provided to Municipalities and Unions of Municipalities to alleviate the Solid Waste Crisis and ensure the proper execution of awarded contracts in the scope of SWAM1 and SWAM 2 . Implementing Workflow and DMS Systems

• Develop and enhance the Anti-Corruption Strategy in terms of making it more in line with international standards mainly the United Nations Convention Against Corruption. • Submission of the updated version of the National Anti-corruption Strategy to the Prime Minister’s Office on 23 September 2019. • Preparatory workshops with Public Administrations required to apply the law and more than 100 public officials attended the workshop. • Together with Gherbal, OMSAR developed a guide for Access to Information Law targeting citizens • UNCAC coordination: OMSAR reactivated the role of the National Team to follow up on the events related to UNCAC and clarified the coordination role that should be in place in order to guarantee proper representation of Lebanon in the related conferences and events. • Access to Information Law: OMSAR, through the joint support of UNDP under ACT Project and OECD, developed a national action plan to enhance the implementation of the law. • E-procurement system English version finalized; Arabic translation subject to last round of verification; • Courses on Bidding Documents and Evaluation translated using own resources • E-learning course on Evaluation being developed (80% complete) • Integrity Guidelines translated using own resources (50% complete) • Training of State Council and Civil Appeal clerks on the use of the system by the OMSAR team • The Contract is closed and OMSAR team is following up on the roll out to other courts and sustainability of the project
